meanings.definition: To make excessive or unnecessary adjustments.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overadjustment her outfit multiple times before leaving the house.
meanings.sent2: He always overadjustment the volume on the TV, never satisfied with the sound.
meanings.sent3: The robot went into overadjustment mode, constantly tweaking its settings for no reason.
meanings.sent4: Her constant overadjustment of the thermostat turned the house into a sauna.
meanings.sent5: The chef's overadjustment of the seasoning ruined the dish, making it too salty to eat.

meanings.definition: The act of adjusting too much or too often.
meanings.sent1: His overadjustment of his tie made it look crooked instead of straight.
meanings.sent2: The constant overadjustment of the chair's height annoyed everyone in the office.
meanings.sent3: The overadjustment of the car seat made it impossible for anyone else to sit comfortably.
meanings.sent4: The overadjustment of the clock led to it running backwards instead of forwards.
meanings.sent5: The overadjustment of the thermostat caused the room to become unbearably hot.
